alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 7:49AM CST until February 16 at 10:45AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Carroll County in Tennessee... Henry County in Tennessee... Southern Weakley County in Tennessee... * Until 1045 AM CST. * At 749 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paris, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Paris Landing State Park, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Sharon, Cottage Grove, Routon, Trezevant, Puryear, Henry, McLemoresville, Como, Ore Springs, Osage, Hico, Whitlock and Porter Court. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
